title: Rachel Riley shares unseen snap of wedding to Pasha Kovalev to mark International Day of the Girl
text:
She tied the knot with her Strictly Come Dancing star beau in a surprise Las Vegas wedding in June this year.

And Rachel Riley has shared a never-before-seen image of her big day with husband Pasha Kovalev as she marks International Day of the Girl.

The Countdown star, 33, took to Instagram on Friday to share the image which sees her and dancer Pasha, 39, posing for a cute selfie moments as they became man and wife.

Wedded bliss: Rachel Riley has shared a never-before-seen image of her big day with husband Pasha Kovalev as she marks International Day of the Girl

Captioning the snap, the pregnant presenter, wrote: 'Sharing this wedding pic with my gorgeous husband on International #DayoftheGirl as I’m one of the lucky ones!

'12 million girls are married each year (nearly one every 2 seconds) before they reach adulthood – which robs them of their right to make their own life choices.

'Love @brides_do_good initiative - get a fabulous wedding dress while helping others at the same time. Check out bridesdogood.com to learn more about how to help end child marriage. #OnlyAGirl.'

Rachel's post on International Day of the Girl comes as she supported Brides Do Good's new #OnlyAGirl campaign, which serves to raise awareness for child marriage in the UK.

Pose: The Countdown star, 33, took to Instagram on Friday to share the image which sees her and Pasha, 39, posing for a cute selfie moments as they became man and wife (pictured in September)

The star has joined several other celebrities in supporting the campaign on social media, which aims to encourage people to sign a petition to support a change in current legislation which would criminalise the act.

Brides Do Good states that child marriage is defined by the United Nations as marriage before the age of 18. Each year, 12 million girls living around the world – including in the UK – are married before they reach this age.

Rachel and her husband Pasha announced they were set to become parents for the first time in May.

Revealing the pregnancy news via the Countdown star's Instagram account, Rachel posed in front of a board of letters spelling out the words 'r tiny mate', an anagram of the word 'maternity', while placing her hands on her baby bump.

Newlyweds: The couple married in Las Vegas in June, keeping the ceremony 'so secret' that most of their friends and family were said to have been completely unaware of the nuptials

It's official! The couple's wedding certificate confirmed that they married in June. According to reports the pair kept the ceremony secret from friends and family

She captioned the sweet snap: 'Pash and I have a conundrum for you... you have till December to work it out! We're over the moon excited.'

The couple went on to marry in Las Vegas in June, keeping the ceremony 'so secret' that the majority of their friends and family were said to have been completely unaware of the nuptials.

Rachel confirmed the news on social media, sharing shared a picture from their big day, captioned: 'Introducing the new Mr and Mrs Kovalev... We both said yes!'

During a recent appearance on Celebrity Gogglebox, Rachel hinted she could be having a baby girl because she 'couldn't see a penis' in her latest scan.

The mathematician first met Pasha when they were partnered on Strictly Come Dancing in 2013, going official with their romance the following year.
description: The Countdown star, 33, took to Instagram on Friday to share a never-before-seen image of her big day with husband Pasha Kovalev to marked International Day of the Girl.
